acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.25mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2005) and others.).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the testing data of rabbit LD50 (dermal route) of >5,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-12, 2001).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,140mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment Vol.3, 2004).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category R by NTP (2005), Category A2 by ACGIH (2001) and Group 2A by IARC (1993).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=398(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on heritable mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity and genotoxicity tests in vivo and positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.33 (2005), IARC 57 (1993) and NTP DB (Access on Dec., 2005).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available - melting point: 110degC (ICSC,1999), test temperature: 140degC

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "mild irritation" from rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.33, 2005).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "extremely mild irritation" from guinea pig skin irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.33, 2005).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Insufficient data available to deny sensitization, although the substance was reported negative in guinea pig skin sensitization tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.33, 2005).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, respiratory system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "mild methemoglobinemia, macrocytic anemia and anemia probably caused by excessive destruction of red blood cells, adenomatosis in the bronchiolar-alveolar junction, hepatocyte hypertrophy, fatty degeneration in the liver, hepatocyte necrosis, bile duct proliferation and fibroplasia" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 3, 2004). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "an increase in blood methemoglobin concentration, weakness, vomiting, achromasia, cyanosis" (MOE Risk Assessment Vol. 3, 2004). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
